definition: sordid and contemptible (idiom); vile and repulsive (esp. character or action)
sordid and contemptible (idiom); vile and repulsive (esp. character or action)

sentences.english: My actual disreputable motive was that I wanted to be the first to call it.
sentences.chinese: 我真正的齷齪動機是想成爲第一個作此斷言的人。

sentences.english: They were rich men. They were also nasty men.
sentences.chinese: 他們都是有錢人，但也都是卑鄙齷齪的傢伙。

sentences.english: Fakers lose their class and play dirty.
sentences.chinese: 騙子隊丟了身價打球齷齪。

sentences.english: His uncle was as base and unworthy as his father had been upright and honourable.
sentences.chinese: 他的叔叔卑鄙齷齪，不像他父親那樣正直可敬。

sentences.english: Have you seen the unwashed miscreants that go to that school ?
sentences.chinese: 難道你沒看到學校那些齷齪的傢伙？

sentences.english: His uncle was as base and unworthy as his father had been upright and honorable.
sentences.chinese: 他的叔叔卑鄙齷齪，不像他父親那樣爲人正直。

sentences.english: He's had something to pay him for his dirty trick, and he'll have more .
sentences.chinese: 他那卑鄙齷齪的詭計要受報應的，還得多受些呢。

definition: to have no sense of shame
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
